column4: I have an nvidia 9600gt and need to install the nvidia binary driver. when I run the installer, though, it does not seem to work. any suggestions?
do you mean installer from nvidia.com?
yes
you know it's recommended to use ubuntu tool for that, or synaptic. But make sure you are not in a graphical interface. Do you have any errors?
is there an ubuntu tool which installs the nvidia 173.08 or higher drivers? and there are no errors, when I restart x afterwards, the screen refresh rate is wrong and the failsafe dialog pops up
did you do nvidia-xconfig?
that tends to load the xorg.conf with really bad stuff (I have it working on another comp). I manually changed the xorg.conf driver to "nvidia"
if there is an error, it will be somewhere in your log. Check /var/log/Xorg.0.log
thank you, will do
you can change your graphical setup with nvidia-settings (if the drivers are loaded properly)
usually the nvidia splash screen shows up if the drivers are loaded, and I have yet to see it
you can check it with glxinfo | grep 'server glx vendor'
one second please
failed to initialize GLX extension (compatible NVIDIA X driver not found)
it seems the driver is just not being installed for some reason
kernel driver? Try "sudo lsmod | nvidia" to see if it's loaded.
it's not there
sudo modprobe nvidia
then log out and log in again. Should be o.k.
Error running install command for nvidia.
lsmod says /sbin/lrm-video: not found
sorry, modprobe says that
